JeanLevel 2. RookieAnswered on 01 Mar 2019Hello!Congrats on clearing your A levels :) With only $500 in savings, it might be a challenge to sustain your investments. There are some considerations you have to take into account for before you starting your investment journey. Firstly, set aside an emergency fund (6 months worth of your fixed expenses) because cash is king. You wouldn’t want to be in a position where you can’t fund for any unexpected emergencies. Secondly, I assume you will be going to university in July/August and based on personal experience, if you’re joining camps/activities/hall etc, there will be quite a few expenses here and there. So you have to consider your future liabilities as well.  If the above doesn’t apply to you and you have regular cash inflow, you can start investing in Singapore Savings bond, STI ETFs (you can apply for this through your bank) and endowment plans. Hope this helps! :)0 comments0
